article_title: Hillary is best equipped to fix Obamacare
article_text:
There are serious problems with health care that must be addressed: cost, finding doctors, insurance companies pulling out

All of this suggests the need to fix the new system, not repeal it

Hillary Clinton successfully led a bipartisan drive to guarantee health care for millions of kids

article_metadata.news-keywords: Hillary Rodham Clinton, Obamacare, insurance companies, Bill Clinton, Sen. Ted Kennedy, Sen. Orin Hatch, CHIP, Irwin Redlener, Columbia University, Columbia College of Physicians and Surgeons, Mailman School of Public Health
article_metadata.description: In a contentious Congress, Hillary Clinton went to the late Democratic Sen. Ted Kennedy and powerful Republican Sen. Orrin Hatch. The three of them built a bipartisan alliance that in 1997 passed CHIP, guaranteeing health care for millions of kids, an accomplishment nobody could have reasonably predicted a year earlier. Hillary Clinton makes things happen. She follows through and knows how to deal with a divided Congress, a skill we need in the White House, now more than ever.
article_metadata.title: Hillary is best equipped to fix Obamacare | Fresno Bee
